articles.title: ASX rises; BlueBet jumps 84pc in IPO
articles.description: S&P/ASX 200 gained in early trade after falling yesterday; iron ore price up overnight; Wall Street closes at new record high.

articles.title: Coles makes major change to health food section
articles.description: Coles has announced a major shift in its supermarket aisles that will change the way customers shop forever.
articles.content:
A scathing and hilarious note left in supermarkets on the Sunshine Coast targeting panic buyers of toilet paper during lockdown has gone viral on Reddit.

articles.title: Optus investigating major network outage across Australia
articles.description: Optus is investigating a major network outage, with hundreds of users saying they are unable to access phone or internet services.
articles.content:
Optus is investigating a major network outage, with hundreds of users saying they are unable to access phone or internet services.

articles.title: Richard Branson aims to beat Jeff Bezos into space by nine days
articles.description: Virgin Galactic founder has announced he will take off on board the next test flight on 11 July
articles.content:
Virgin Galactic’s Richard Branson is aiming to beat fellow billionaire Jeff Bezos into space by nine days.
Branson’s company announced on Thursday evening that its next test flight will take place on 11 July and that its founder will be among the six... [2598 chars]

articles.title: ASX set for gains as Wall Street extends winning streak
articles.description: Wall Street has kicked off the second half of the year with more gains, setting up the Australian sharemarket for a positive open this morning.
articles.content:
Stocks finished broadly higher on Wall Street on Thursday (US time), adding to the gains that helped the market close out its best first half of a year since the dotcom bubble.
The S&P 500 rose 0.5 per cent, marking its sixth straight gain and fourth... [905 chars]

articles.description: Small business owners who have been denied payouts for COVID losses are taking the next step against their insurers, but admit it is a long and unsure road ahead.
articles.content:
Small business owners who have been denied insurance payouts for COVID losses are taking their fight to the next level by joining class action lawsuits against several industry giants.

articles.title: Chinese foreign investors have cooled on Australian properties, but overseas buyers are tipped to return
articles.description: Overseas buyers from China and other countries are looking to return to buy property in Australia — to reside in, rather than mere investments, experts say.
articles.content:
Chinese foreign investors who abandoned the Australian property market last financial year could soon return, according to real estate agents and analysts who say enquiries and sales are on the rise.

articles.title: Hills horror show comes to a close
articles.description: Jennifer Hill-Ling has quit after nearly 16 years as chairwoman and about 97 per cent wiped from the value of the company she led.
articles.content: Let’s just say there’s plenty of shareholders happy to see the back of Hills chairwoman Jennifer Hill-Ling after the group said she’d vacate the role on Thursday and retire as a director later this year. Hill-Ling’s near 16-year reign saw 97 per cent... [1642 chars]

articles.title: Jab confusion: Genuine vaccination information mistaken for scams
articles.description: Many COVID-19 vaccination “scams” reported by the public in fact prove to be genuine communications, but the ACCC still wants consumers to be vigilant.
articles.content:
Confusion about the COVID-19 vaccine rollout has shown up in official scam complaints, with more than 90 per cent of vaccination-related reports to the federal government’s Scamwatch service last month proving to be about genuine communications.
